author: Simon Rimmer
method: For the halibut, brush the halibut steaks with a little oil and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Press the breadcrumbs onto both sides of the fish. Heat a little oil in a pan and fry the halibut steaks over a medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown and cooked through. Set aside in a warm place. For the sauce, heat the oil in the same pan used to cook the fish, add the shallots, garlic and ginger and fry gently for 3-4 minutes until softened. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook until they begin to burst open, then add the red wine vinegar, sugar, ketchup and fish sauce and simmer for 2-3 minutes. To serve, place the halibut steaks onto serving plates and spoon over the sauce. Garnish with coriander and shredded spring onions and serve with jasmine rice.
ingredients: 4 x 175g/6¼oz halibut steaks,  oil, for brushing and frying,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  125g/4½oz Japanese panko breadcrumbs, or use brioche breadcrumbs,  2 tbsp oil,  3 shallots, sliced,  2 garlic cloves, crushed,  2.5cm/1in piece fresh ginger, cut into matchsticks,  225g/8oz cherry tomatoes,  30ml/1fl oz red wine vinegar,  30g/1oz caster sugar,  50ml/2fl oz tomato ketchup,  1 tbsp Thai fish sauce,  few sprigs fresh coriander,  finely sliced spring onion,  steamed jasmine rice
